org.cougaar.mts.udp
Class UdpMulticastLinkProtocol

java.lang.Object
  org.cougaar.util.GenericStateModelAdapter
      org.cougaar.core.component.ParameterizedComponent
          org.cougaar.mts.base.BoundComponent
              org.cougaar.mts.base.LinkProtocol
                  org.cougaar.mts.base.RPCLinkProtocol
                      org.cougaar.mts.udp.UdpMulticastLinkProtocol
All Implemented Interfaces:
Component, ServiceProvider, GenericStateModel
public class UdpMulticastLinkProtocol
extends RPCLinkProtocol

Multicast via UDP.

This protocol only knows how to send to an InetMulticastMessageAddress, which is assumed to be contain a multicast address.

For reading, it will poll every InetMulticastMessageAddress to which it's currently joined.

computeCost

protected int computeCost(AttributedMessage message)
Specified by:
computeCost in class RPCLinkProtocol
Returns:
the cost of transmitting the message over this protocol. This is invoked from the Link inner class and is defined here because the cost mathematics is typically not specific to a given link and is therefore easier to implement at the protocol level.

createDestinationLink

protected DestinationLink createDestinationLink(MessageAddress address)
Description copied from class: RPCLinkProtocol
Return a protocol-specific DestinationLink for the target address. The name should not be taken to mean that a new link will be created for every call.

Specified by:
createDestinationLink in class RPCLinkProtocol

ensureNodeServant

protected void ensureNodeServant()
Description copied from class: RPCLinkProtocol
Ensure that some abstract form of 'servant' object exists for this protocol that will allow other Nodes to send messages to this one.

NB: ensureNodeServant should only be called from RPCLinkProtocol.remakeNodeServant()!.

Specified by:
ensureNodeServant in class RPCLinkProtocol

releaseNodeServant

protected void releaseNodeServant()
Description copied from class: RPCLinkProtocol
Releases all resources associated with this link protocol.

This method is invoked when the MTS is unloaded so the garbage collector can reclaim all resources that had been allocated. Fix for bug 3965.

Specified by:
releaseNodeServant in class RPCLinkProtocol

remakeNodeServant

protected void remakeNodeServant()
Description copied from class: RPCLinkProtocol
Force the protocol to remake its 'servant', typically because the address of the Host on which the Node is running has changed. Some protocol (eg HTTP) can ignore this.

The definition of this method is specific to each protocol, but invocations should only happen in this class, specifically in RPCLinkProtocol.ensureNodeServantIsAlive().

Specified by:
remakeNodeServant in class RPCLinkProtocol

isServantAlive

protected boolean isServantAlive()
We must have an open UDP socket and a non-null servant

Overrides:
isServantAlive in class RPCLinkProtocol
